intro: Barleria tanzaniana, commonly known as the Tanzanian barleria, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Barleria tanzaniana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping.
